description: An illustration of a bingo card consisting of a 5x5 grid with various black geometric shapes on it; the grid has a yellow five-pointed star in the center denoting a free space. There are 12 squares in the grid with a red circle covering the black geometric shape to indicate that those shapes have been called (if the columns of the grid were to be numbered 1 through 5 and the rows of the grid were to be lettered A through E, then there would be red circles on A4; B2 and B5; C1, C4, and C5; D1, D2, and D4; and E1, E3, and E5. Above and to the right of the bingo card is a white dauber marker with a red circular tip.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
